title: Test
yAxis: Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points.
Overall Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year

Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars is roughly constant from 2007 to 2008, rapidly increasing from 2008 to 2009, rapidly decreasing from 2009 to 2010, roughly constant from 2010 to 2012, rapidly increasing from 2012 to 2013, roughly constant from 2013 to 2015, rapidly decreasing from 2015 to 2017, and lastly rapidly increasing from 2017 to 2018.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2017 and 2018.
Max Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 8.19 was recorded at Year 2009
Min Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars about 1.54 was recorded at Year 2017
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 4 significant trends.
The longest trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2011 to 2015.
Correspondingly, the next significant trend is extremely decreasing which exists from 2015 to 2018.
But, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2009 to 2011.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2007 to 2009.
